featured.text: The situation worsened when the industrial production of vodka began in the country, causing its prices to drop sharply and making it available to even low-income citizens.
Vodka, Russia’s national drink, was not a Russian invention.
This soon filled the state treasury with huge revenues, but it also encouraged vodka consumption.
The first Russian-made vodka appeared in the 15th century, and the drink remained relatively low in alcohol content until the mid-18th century.

other.text: In the 19th century, the emperors began to establish a state monopoly, largely due to the rise of illegal production of low-quality vodka.
Which of the following is true about vodka production? (A) Vodka production in Russia started in the 15th century.
The first vodka made from wheat was imported from France.
To link Russians’ vodka consumption to their adoption of Christianity. 44.

definition.zh_def: 一種由穀物或馬鈴薯發酵而成的烈酒，通常無色且味道強烈。
definition.en_def: A clear distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grains or potatoes, typically strong in flavor.
definition.example: She ordered a vodka tonic at the bar.
